conclusion: Analyze the scene step by step to determine collisions and stopping point.
Car A is entering from the right side of the image, moving towards the left.
The first block in A's path is the orange block near the bottom right.
After colliding with the orange block, A might deflect towards the blue block directly above it.
A hits the orange block; depending on the force, A might stop or continue with reduced speed.
If A continues, it will likely hit the blue block, causing a change in direction slightly upwards or stopping.
If A stops after the first collision, it will be near the orange block.
If A continues and collides with the blue block, it might stop near or between the orange and blue blocks.
Assuming A has moderate power, it might collide with one or two blocks before stopping.
The green surface suggests minimal friction, allowing A to travel further unless obstructed by blocks.
Car A will likely collide with the orange block first and may also collide with the blue block above it, eventually stopping near the orange block or between the orange and blue blocks.
